creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
text: The title of this work appears to be a later addition, as it is written on the book’s cover in a hand that does not appear to be the artist’s, who was by no means an ‘old man’ when he filled its pages. As well as painting, Chikutō wrote on music, poetry, and art.
title: Old Man Chikutō’s Sketchbook
